page.title: 17A Day At A Secondary School
page.content: It was a Tuesday. I had finished my science and maths homework. The usual day with maths, French, English, library lesson, French again, then lunch hour, back to lessons history, all about Middle Ages and then needle work, and yes boys do attend this lesson. Then homework, English and French. There are over 1,000 pupils at Owens and about 300 acres of ground, tennis courts, lake, woods, greens and fields. The day starts 9.05 in the morning and goes on to 3.40 p.m. There are many clubs in the school e.g. history club, orchestra, choir, model railway and angling club. There are three assemblies in a week and two form periods for the first year. The first years have lockers and the other years have cupboards. Stephen Green 1E.
